intro: Heptapleurum rhododendrifolium, commonly known as the red-leaf heptapleurum, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with striking red or orange hues on the underside of the leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale pink, and appear in late spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
